conclusion: Understanding how shadows change when the light source moves backward.
Initial setup: Light source above objects casting shadows A, B, C, and D.
Objects are fixed in position on the table.
Moving the light source backward increases the distance between the light source and the objects.
As the distance increases, shadows become smaller due to decreased angle of incidence.
Shadows will move forward on the ground as the light source moves backward.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will become smaller and move forward.
